WPAdBlock.comment: An advertising section of the page.

WebSite.comment: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

DayOfWeek.comment:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.

Originally, URLs from [GoodRelations](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1) were used (for [[Monday]], [[Tuesday]], [[Wednesday]], [[Thursday]], [[Friday]], [[Saturday]], [[Sunday]] plus a special entry for [[PublicHolidays]]); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

TaxiService.comment: A service for a vehicle for hire with a driver for local travel. Fares are usually calculated based on distance traveled.

fields.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.
fields.name: musicBy

fields.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.
fields.name: trailer

fields.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: director

fields.comment: An episode of a tv, radio or game media within a series or season.
fields.name: episode

fields.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: actor

fields.comment: A season that is part of the media series.
fields.name: containsSeason

fields.comment: The number of seasons in this series.
fields.name: numberOfSeasons

fields.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.
fields.name: productionCompany

fields.comment: The number of episodes in this season or series.
fields.name: numberOfEpisodes

RadioSeries.comment: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

fields.comment: An educationalRole of an EducationalAudience.
fields.name: educationalRole

fields.comment: A sub property of object. The object that replaces.
fields.name: replacer

fields.comment: A sub property of object. The object that is being replaced.
fields.name: replacee

ReplaceAction.comment: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

ParkingFacility.comment: A parking lot or other parking facility.

AllocateAction.comment: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

Attorney.comment:
Professional service: Attorney.

This type is deprecated - LegalService is more inclusive and less ambiguous.

PaymentMethod.comment:
A payment method is a standardized procedure for transferring the monetary amount for a purchase. Payment methods are characterized by the legal and technical structures used, and by the organization or group carrying out the transaction.
Commonly used values:

http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByBankTransferInAdvance
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByInvoice
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Cash
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#CheckInAdvance
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#COD
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DirectDebit
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#GoogleCheckout
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PayPal
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PaySwarm

InstallAction.comment: The act of installing an application.

fields.comment:
The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
fields.name: startTime

fields.comment: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.
fields.name: target

fields.comment: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.
fields.name: participant

fields.comment: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.
fields.name: instrument

fields.comment: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.
fields.name: agent

fields.comment: The object upon the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read *a book*.
fields.name: object

fields.comment: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.
fields.name: actionStatus

fields.comment: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.
fields.name: result

fields.comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.
fields.name: location

fields.comment: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.
fields.name: error

fields.comment:
The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
fields.name: endTime

Action.comment:
An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.

See also blog post and Actions overview document.

EventStatusType.comment: EventStatusType is an enumeration type whose instances represent several states that an Event may be in.

EatAction.comment: The act of swallowing solid objects.

AccountingService.comment:
Accountancy business.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

fields.comment: The time the object is scheduled to.
fields.name: scheduledTime

PlanAction.comment: The act of planning the execution of an event/task/action/reservation/plan to a future date.

fields.comment: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".
fields.name: pageStart

fields.comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".
fields.name: pageEnd

fields.comment: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.
fields.name: articleSection

fields.comment: The actual body of the article.
fields.name: articleBody

fields.comment: The number of words in the text of the Article.
fields.name: wordCount

fields.comment: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".
fields.name: pagination

Article.comment:
An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.

See also blog post.

fields.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.
fields.name: musicBy

fields.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.
fields.name: trailer

fields.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: director

fields.comment: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in IETF BCP 47 standard format.
fields.name: subtitleLanguage

fields.comment: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.
fields.name: countryOfOrigin

fields.comment: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.
fields.name: duration

fields.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: actor

fields.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.
fields.name: productionCompany

DepositAccount.comment: A type of Bank Account with a main purpose of depositing funds to gain interest or other benefits.

Car.comment: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

Code.comment: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

PresentationDigitalDocument.comment: A file containing slides or used for a presentation.

fields.comment: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.
fields.name: bestRating

fields.comment: The rating for the content.
fields.name: ratingValue

fields.comment: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.
fields.name: worstRating

Rating.comment: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

AssessAction.comment: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

RadioClip.comment: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

fields.comment: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.
fields.name: deliveryMethod

fields.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
fields.name: recipient

SendAction.comment:
The act of physically/electronically dispatching an object for transfer from an origin to a destination.

Related actions:

  • ReceiveAction: The reciprocal of SendAction.
  • GiveAction: Unlike GiveAction, SendAction does not imply the transfer of ownership (e.g. I can send you my laptop, but I'm not necessarily giving it to you)
.

fields.comment: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. Useful for videos.
fields.name: expires

fields.comment: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in ISO 3166 format.
fields.name: regionsAllowed

fields.comment: mp3, mpeg4, etc.
fields.name: encodingFormat

fields.comment: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the src element of an embed tag and should not be the same as the content of the loc tag.
fields.name: embedUrl

fields.comment: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription (either paid or free). Allowed values are true or false (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').
fields.name: requiresSubscription

fields.comment: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.
fields.name: playerType

fields.comment: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.
fields.name: duration

fields.comment: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.
fields.name: contentUrl

fields.comment: The width of the item.
fields.name: width

fields.comment: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.
fields.name: associatedArticle

fields.comment: File size in (mega/kilo) bytes.
fields.name: contentSize

fields.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.
fields.name: productionCompany

fields.comment: Date when this media object was uploaded to this site.
fields.name: uploadDate

fields.comment: The bitrate of the media object.
fields.name: bitrate

fields.comment: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.
fields.name: encodesCreativeWork

fields.comment: The height of the item.
fields.name: height

MediaObject.comment: An image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

LegalService.comment:
A LegalService is a business that provides legally-oriented services, advice and representation, e.g. law firms.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

TrainReservation.comment: A reservation for train travel.Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use http://schema.org/Offer.

fields.comment: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.
fields.name: serialNumber

IndividualProduct.comment: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

fields.comment: The amount of money.
fields.name: amount

fields.comment: Assets required to secure loan or credit repayments. It may take form of third party pledge, goods, financial instruments (cash, securities, etc.)
fields.name: requiredCollateral

fields.comment: The duration of the loan or credit agreement.
fields.name: loanTerm

LoanOrCredit.comment: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money under agreed terms and charges.

fields.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.
fields.name: offers

fields.comment: The highest price of all offers available.
fields.name: highPrice

fields.comment: The lowest price of all offers available.
fields.name: lowPrice

fields.comment: The number of offers for the product.
fields.name: offerCount

AggregateOffer.comment: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.

BusinessEntityType.comment:
A business entity type is a conceptual entity representing the legal form, the size, the main line of business, the position in the value chain, or any combination thereof, of an organization or business person.
Commonly used values:

http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Business
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Enduser
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PublicInstitution
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Reseller

fields.comment: The postal code. For example, 94043.
fields.name: postalCode

fields.comment: The post office box number for PO box addresses.
fields.name: postOfficeBoxNumber

fields.comment: The locality. For example, Mountain View.
fields.name: addressLocality

fields.comment: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.
fields.name: addressCountry

fields.comment: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.
fields.name: streetAddress

fields.comment: The region. For example, CA.
fields.name: addressRegion

fields.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.
fields.name: event

InviteAction.comment: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

fields.comment: Genre of the creative work or group.
fields.name: genre

fields.comment: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.
fields.name: track

fields.comment: A music album.
fields.name: album

MusicGroup.comment: A musical group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a choir. Can also be a solo musician.

UseAction.comment: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.

fields.comment: The amount of money.
fields.name: amount

fields.comment: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
fields.name: startDate

fields.comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format).
fields.name: currency

fields.comment: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).
fields.name: endDate

DatedMoneySpecification.comment: A DatedMoneySpecification represents monetary values with optional start and end dates. For example, this could represent an employee's salary over a specific period of time. __Note:__ This type has been superseded by [[MonetaryAmount]] use of that type is recommended

TieAction.comment: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

PhotographAction.comment: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

MiddleSchool.comment: A middle school (typically for children aged around 11-14, although this varies somewhat).

TVClip.comment: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

ReserveAction.comment:
Reserving a concrete object.

Related actions:

  • ScheduleAction: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e.g. a table, a hotel) towards a time slot / spatial allocation
.

fields.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.
fields.name: unitCode

fields.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.
fields.name: minValue

fields.comment: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.
fields.name: unitText

fields.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.
fields.name: valueReference

fields.comment:
A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be
(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3)
a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).
Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.
fields.name: propertyID

fields.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.
For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryValue, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
fields.name: value

fields.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.
fields.name: maxValue

PropertyValue.comment:
A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.

Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

fields.comment: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.
fields.name: advanceBookingRequirement

fields.comment: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.
fields.name: priceCurrency

fields.comment: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.
fields.name: availableDeliveryMethod

fields.comment: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.
fields.name: priceSpecification

fields.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.
fields.name: validFrom

fields.comment: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.
fields.name: businessFunction

fields.comment: The item being offered.
fields.name: itemOffered

fields.comment: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.
fields.name: includesObject

fields.comment: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.
fields.name: gtin14

fields.comment: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.
fields.name: gtin13

fields.comment: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.
fields.name: gtin12

fields.comment: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).
fields.name: availableAtOrFrom

fields.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.
fields.name: warranty

fields.comment: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.
fields.name: inventoryLevel

fields.comment: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.
fields.name: offeredBy

fields.comment: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.
fields.name: availabilityStarts

fields.comment: The duration for which the given offer is valid.
fields.name: eligibleDuration

fields.comment: A review of the item.
fields.name: review

fields.comment: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.
fields.name: eligibleTransactionVolume

fields.comment: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.
fields.name: mpn

fields.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.
fields.name: areaServed

fields.comment: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.
fields.name: serialNumber

fields.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.
fields.name: seller

fields.comment: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.
fields.name: acceptedPaymentMethod

fields.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
fields.name: validThrough

fields.comment: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.
fields.name: availability

fields.comment: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.
fields.name: sku

fields.comment: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.
fields.name: gtin8

fields.comment: The date after which the price is no longer available.
fields.name: priceValidUntil

fields.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:
  • Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
fields.name: price

fields.comment: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods leaving the warehouse.
fields.name: deliveryLeadTime

fields.comment: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.
fields.name: eligibleQuantity

fields.comment:
The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.

See also eligibleRegion.
fields.name: ineligibleRegion

fields.comment: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.
fields.name: itemCondition

fields.comment:
The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.

See also ineligibleRegion.
fields.name: eligibleRegion

fields.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.
fields.name: aggregateRating

fields.comment: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.
fields.name: eligibleCustomerType

fields.comment: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.
fields.name: availabilityEnds

fields.comment: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).
fields.name: addOn

fields.comment: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.
fields.name: category

Offer.comment:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service—for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

For GTIN-related fields, see Check Digit calculator and validation guide from GS1.

GovernmentOffice.comment: A government office—for example, an IRS or DMV office.

fields.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.
fields.name: event

InformAction.comment: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

AdministrativeArea.comment: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

fields.comment: A pointer to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive.
fields.name: isVariantOf

fields.comment: A pointer from a newer variant of a product  to its previous, often discontinued predecessor.
fields.name: successorOf

fields.comment: A pointer from a previous, often discontinued variant of the product to its newer variant.
fields.name: predecessorOf

ProductModel.comment: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

fields.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.
fields.name: validFrom

fields.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.
fields.name: minValue

fields.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
fields.name: validThrough

fields.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.
For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryValue, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
fields.name: value

fields.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.
fields.name: maxValue

fields.comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format).
fields.name: currency

MonetaryAmount.comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

fields.comment: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.
fields.name: borrower

LendAction.comment:
The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date. Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

Related actions:

  • BorrowAction: Reciprocal of LendAction
.

fields.comment: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).
fields.name: sport

SportsOrganization.comment: Represents the collection of all sports organizations, including sports teams, governing bodies, and sports associations.

QuoteAction.comment: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.

fields.comment: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.
fields.name: appliesToDeliveryMethod

fields.comment: The payment method(s) to which the payment charge specification applies.
fields.name: appliesToPaymentMethod

PaymentChargeSpecification.comment: The costs of settling the payment using a particular payment method.

fields.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.
fields.name: toLocation

InsertAction.comment: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.

CancelAction.comment:
The act of asserting that a future event/action is no longer going to happen.

Related actions:

  • ConfirmAction: The antonym of CancelAction
.

WebPageElement.comment: A web page element, like a table or an image.

fields.comment: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.
fields.name: iataCode

fields.comment: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).
fields.name: boardingPolicy

Airline.comment: An organization that provides flights for passengers.

Date.comment: A date value in ISO 8601 date format.

fields.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.
fields.name: musicBy

fields.comment: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.
fields.name: clipNumber

fields.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: director

fields.comment: The episode to which this clip belongs.
fields.name: partOfEpisode

fields.comment: The season to which this episode belongs.
fields.name: partOfSeason

fields.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: actor

fields.comment: The series to which this episode or season belongs.
fields.name: partOfSeries

Clip.comment: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

fields.comment: Alumni of an organization.
fields.name: alumni

fields.comment: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.
fields.name: resultComment

ReplyAction.comment:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to AskAction.

Related actions:

fields.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:
  • Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

CreativeWorkSeries.comment:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike ItemList which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing TVSeries, RadioSeries, MovieSeries, BookSeries, Periodical and VideoGameSeries. In each case, the hasPart / isPartOf properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

.

fields.comment:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements. Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

fields.comment: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

FollowAction.comment:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

  • BefriendAction: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is *not* necessarily reciprocal.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
  • TrackAction: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it)
.

fields.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

fields.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:
  • Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
fields.name: price

BreadcrumbList.comment:
A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.

The 'position' property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList. The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an itemListOrder of ItemListOrderAscending (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.

See also blog post.

A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.
The place is open if the opens property is specified, and closed otherwise.
If the value for the closes property is less than the value for the opens property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

fields.comment:
The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'.
- Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su.
- Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00.
- Here is an example: <span itemprop="openingHours" content="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</span>.
- If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <span itemprop="openingHours" content="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</span>.
fields.name: openingHours

Original definition: "provider of professional services."

The general ProfessionalService type for local businesses was deprecated due to confusion with Service. For reference, the types that it included were: Dentist, AccountingService, Attorney, Notary, as well as types for several kinds of HomeAndConstructionBusiness: Electrician, GeneralContractor, HousePainter, Locksmith, Plumber, RoofingContractor. LegalService was introduced as a more inclusive supertype of Attorney.

DeliveryMethod.comment:
A delivery method is a standardized procedure for transferring the product or service to the destination of fulfillment chosen by the customer. Delivery methods are characterized by the means of transportation used, and by the organization or group that is the contracting party for the sending organization or person.
Commonly used values:

http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeDirectDownload
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeFreight
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeMail
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeOwnFleet
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModePickUp
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

RegisterAction.comment:
The act of registering to be a user of a service, product or web page.

Related actions:

  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, RegisterAction implies you are registering to be a user of a service, *not* a group/team of people.
  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting to poll for updates from the object.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting updates from the object
.

Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class.
Commonly used values:

http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation

SubscribeAction.comment:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, SubscribeAction implies that the subscriber acts as a passive agent being constantly/actively pushed for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object
.

ApplyAction.comment:
The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, ApplyAction has no guarantees that the application will be accepted
.

fields.comment:
The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'.
- Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su.
- Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00.
- Here is an example: <span itemprop="openingHours" content="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</span>.
- If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <span itemprop="openingHours" content="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</span>.
fields.name: openingHours

fields.comment:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).
Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km.
Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km. Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.
fields.name: fuelConsumption

fields.comment: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

fields.comment:
The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.

fields.comment:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).
Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter.
Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L. Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.
fields.name: fuelEfficiency

fields.comment: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

fields.comment:
The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
fields.name: startTime

fields.comment: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

fields.comment:
The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.
fields.name: endTime

A card payment method of a particular brand or name. Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.
Commonly used values:

http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard

TrackAction.comment:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimate objects
.

Conversation.comment: One or more messages between organizations or people on a particular topic. Individual messages can be linked to the conversation with isPartOf or hasPart properties.

BusReservation.comment: A reservation for bus travel.Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use http://schema.org/Offer.

RsvpResponseType.comment: RsvpResponseType is an enumeration type whose instances represent responding to an RSVP request.

fields.comment: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").
fields.name: productSupported

fields.comment: A language someone may use with the item. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also [[inLanguage]].
fields.name: availableLanguage

fields.comment: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.
fields.name: contactType

fields.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.
fields.name: areaServed

fields.comment: The hours during which this service or contact is available.
fields.name: hoursAvailable

fields.comment: Email address.
fields.name: email

fields.comment: The fax number.
fields.name: faxNumber

fields.comment: The telephone number.
fields.name: telephone

fields.comment: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).
fields.name: contactOption

ContactPoint.comment: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

RVPark.comment: A place offering space for "Recreational Vehicles", Caravans, mobile homes and the like.

LikeAction.comment: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

DepartAction.comment: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from an fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.

fields.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
fields.name: recipient

TipAction.comment: The act of giving money voluntarily to a beneficiary in recognition of services rendered.

WPHeader.comment: The header section of the page.

fields.comment: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.
fields.name: educationalFramework

fields.comment: The name of a node in an established educational framework.
fields.name: targetName

fields.comment: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationLevel'.
fields.name: alignmentType

fields.comment: The description of a node in an established educational framework.
fields.name: targetDescription

fields.comment: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.
fields.name: targetUrl

AlignmentObject.comment: An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

UserTweets.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

GovernmentPermit.comment: A permit issued by a government agency.

fields.comment: The name of the item.
fields.name: name

fields.comment: URL of the item.
fields.name: url

fields.comment: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
fields.name: image

fields.comment: A description of the item.
fields.name: description

fields.comment: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
fields.name: disambiguatingDescription

fields.comment: An alias for the item.
fields.name: alternateName

fields.comment: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
fields.name: sameAs

fields.comment: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
fields.name: additionalType

fields.comment: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
fields.name: potentialAction

fields.comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.
fields.name: mainEntityOfPage

Thing.comment: The most generic type of item.

fields.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.
fields.name: musicBy

fields.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.
fields.name: trailer

fields.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: director

fields.comment: The server on which  it is possible to play the game.
fields.name: gameServer

fields.comment: Cheat codes to the game.
fields.name: cheatCode

fields.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.
fields.name: actor

fields.comment: Links to tips, tactics, etc.
fields.name: gameTip

fields.comment: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.
fields.name: playMode

fields.comment: The electronic systems used to play video games.
fields.name: gamePlatform

VideoGame.comment: A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device.

fields.comment: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.
fields.name: executableLibraryName

fields.comment: Associated product/technology version. e.g., .NET Framework 4.5.
fields.name: assemblyVersion

fields.comment: Indicates whether API is managed or unmanaged.
fields.name: programmingModel

fields.comment: Type of app development: phone, Metro style, desktop, XBox, etc.
fields.name: targetPlatform

APIReference.comment: Reference documentation for application programming interfaces (APIs).

DiscussionForumPosting.comment: A posting to a discussion forum.

WPSideBar.comment: A sidebar section of the page.

Series.comment: A Series in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind.

ImageGallery.comment: Web page type: Image gallery page.

fields.comment: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.
fields.name: upvoteCount

fields.comment: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.
fields.name: downvoteCount

fields.comment: The parent of a question, answer or item in general.
fields.name: parentItem

Comment.comment: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the "text" property, and its topic via "about", properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

fields.comment: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).
fields.name: printPage

fields.comment: The location where the NewsArticle was produced.
fields.name: dateline

fields.comment: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.
fields.name: printEdition

fields.comment: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.
fields.name: printSection

fields.comment: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.
fields.name: printColumn

fields.comment: The depth of the item.
fields.name: depth

fields.comment: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)
fields.name: artMedium

fields.comment: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.
fields.name: artform

fields.comment: The width of the item.
fields.name: width

fields.comment: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").
fields.name: artEdition

fields.comment: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.
fields.name: artworkSurface

fields.comment: The height of the item.
fields.name: height

VisualArtwork.comment: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

fields.comment: The overall order the items in this delivery were included in.
fields.name: partOfOrder

fields.comment: The earliest date the package may arrive.
fields.name: expectedArrivalFrom

fields.comment: Tracking url for the parcel delivery.
fields.name: trackingUrl

fields.comment: Shipper's address.
fields.name: originAddress

fields.comment: Item(s) being shipped.
fields.name: itemShipped

fields.comment: Destination address.
fields.name: deliveryAddress

fields.comment: New entry added as the package passes through each leg of its journey (from shipment to final delivery).
fields.name: deliveryStatus

fields.comment: The latest date the package may arrive.
fields.name: expectedArrivalUntil

fields.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.
fields.name: provider

fields.comment: Shipper tracking number.
fields.name: trackingNumber

fields.comment: Method used for delivery or shipping.
fields.name: hasDeliveryMethod

ParcelDelivery.comment: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

ShareAction.comment: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

fields.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.
fields.name: seller

BuyAction.comment: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent buys an object, product, or service from a seller for a price. Reciprocal of SellAction.

fields.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
fields.name: recipient

GiveAction.comment:
The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination. Reciprocal of TakeAction.

Related actions:

  • TakeAction: Reciprocal of GiveAction.
  • SendAction: Unlike SendAction, GiveAction implies that ownership is being transferred (e.g. I may send my laptop to you, but that doesn't mean I'm giving it to you)
.

fields.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
fields.name: recipient

ReturnAction.comment: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

ComputerLanguage.comment: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the [[Language]] type.

fields.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.
fields.name: recipient

DonateAction.comment: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

fields.comment: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).
fields.name: gameLocation

fields.comment: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.
fields.name: quest

fields.comment: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.
fields.name: gameItem

fields.comment: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).
fields.name: numberOfPlayers

fields.comment: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).
fields.name: characterAttribute

Game.comment: The Game type represents things which are games. These are typically rule-governed recreational activities, e.g. role-playing games in which players assume the role of characters in a fictional setting.

DownloadAction.comment: The act of downloading an object.

ActivateAction.comment: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

fields.comment: The timezone in ISO 8601 format for which the service bases its broadcasts.
fields.name: broadcastTimezone

fields.comment: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.
fields.name: broadcastDisplayName

fields.comment: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.
fields.name: broadcastAffiliateOf

fields.comment: A broadcast service to which the broadcast service may belong to such as regional variations of a national channel.
fields.name: parentService

fields.comment: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.
fields.name: broadcaster

BroadcastService.comment: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.
